PM...The devices that don't support monetization, don't support  my efforts, financially. Therefore, they will no longer appear on devices  that aren't "monetized". My revenue is generated from each view via the ads  placed at the beginning of each tutorial by Google Adsense. Examples of  monetized platforms are YouTube(dot)com & YT native apps on Android, Xbox &  GoogleTV.

annooz patrick...Thanks. FYI: My recent tutorials have been transcribed for language translation. If the tutorial has a "CC" icon next to it, it means  it's been correctly transcribed into English. Simply click on the  "captions" icon at the bottom of the video and then click "Finnish" for its  translation!

I guess the only option is to expand the selection further than  normal.﻿

Instead of using quick selection tool, lasso tool can also be used
I have another suggestion, Pucker tool might produce the same result instead of forward wrap tool
Be careful when making a copy, sometimes in different version like CS5 it creates problem. In that case you need to click the button for duplicate layer.
Before using modify command make sure to select something otherwise it might grayed out.
I found it useful to check selection options before bluring. otherwise the blur might not work.

This thing can be done without using splatter brush. Instead splash image with thresholding the adjustment layer same thing can be done. I have done it in latest Photoshop CC.
photoshop cs4 users be careful. the brush size in thumbnail is not like cs6.
in photoshop elements 13 the selection for content aware inside fill is bit different. same technique would not work in there. users have to use different tool for that.
